result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetri D Shurn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1g.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all mandatory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid by 3/18/2016.  Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment will be entered.

Concurrent with: AS TO COUNTS ONE AND TWO, EACH COUNT:  Concurrent with each other,  and consecutive to any other sentence.  Release to Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendasnt of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.
Concurrent with: AS STATED IN COUNT ONE.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demetri D Shurn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter filed by Jerry D. Butler.

Defendant Demetri D Shurn in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Demetri D Shurn in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent to COUNT 2 and consecutive to any sentence; release for the Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge by 3-18-2016. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent to COUNT 1 and consecutive to any sentence; release for the Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge by 3-18-2016. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending Sentencing.

Defendant Demetri D Shurn in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Demetri D Shurn in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT  1 & 2- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  
Case adjourned for Sentencing on 3-18-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Demetri D Shurn not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is in custody, produced but not in court for the purposes of scheduling.
Case held off the record. Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing. Attorney Kastenson is in trial in another court and requests adjournment. Case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 3-3-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
NO REPLY FROM SURETY OR DEFENDANT

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Demetri D Shurn not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is produced, not brought to the courtroom for off the record hearing. Case held off the record. For the reasons presented to the Court off the record the case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 2-24-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($250.00) ad

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant may not possess cash in an amount greater than $150.00 in coins or bills at one time.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Attorney Daryl A. Kastenson in court, defendant Demetri D Shurn not in court, in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Return on Warrant. Arguments heard as to bail. Court forfeits cash bail previously posted. Court sets cash bail. Case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 1-23-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.
Bench warrant served. Original in Court file.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Demetri D Shurn in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Demetri D Shurn in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor count 2.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
